content.title: Important
properties: Slope is positive: The line goes upward as it goes from left to right.
Slope is negative: The line goes downward as it goes from left to right.
Slope is 0: The line is horizontal. Its equation is of the form y = k, for some constant k.
Slope is undefined: The line is vertical. Its equation is of the form x = h, for some constant h.

content.title: Important
content.description: Slope can be thought of as a measure of steepness. A line with a large positive slope is very steep, meaning it is close to a vertical line. A line with a very small positive slope close to 0, such as 1/10, is not at all steep; it's close to a horizontal line. We can apply this to negative slopes as well. Lines with slopes that are very negative are nearly vertical, while lines with negative slopes very close to 0, such as -0.01, are nearly horizontal.

content.question: Which three of the following four points lie on the same straight line: (32,5), (24,18), (22,21), (17,29)

content.question: If the equation of a line is written in the form y = mx + b, where m and b are constants, must m equal the slope of the line? Must b be the y-coordinate of the y-intercept?

solution.slope_proof: The slope of a line measures how much y changes as x changes. From the equation y = mx + b, we can see that increasing x by 1 increases y by m, so the change in y divided by the change in x is m/1 = m.
solution.y_intercept_proof: The y-intercept of the line has x-coordinate x = 0. When x = 0, we have y = m(0) + b = b. Therefore, (0, b) must be the y-intercept.
solution.conclusion: The form y = mx + b is called the slope-intercept form of a line.

cases: Case 1: b \neq b_2. If b_1 \neq b_2, then the equation 0 = b_1 - b_2 has no solutions. This means there is no ordered pair (x, y) that satisfies both y = mx + b_1 and y = mx + b_2. Therefore, the graphs of these equations are lines that never meet, which means the lines are parallel.
Case 2: b_1 = b_2. This makes the equations y = mx + b_1 and y = mx + b_2 the same. As we saw in Problem 8.24, this means that the graphs of these equations are the same line.
solution.general_rule: Two lines with the same slope are either parallel or the same line.

summary.no_solutions: If the graphs of the equations are parallel lines, the system has no solutions.
summary.one_solution: If the graphs of the equations are different lines that are not parallel, the graphs intersect in exactly one point, so the system has exactly one solution.
summary.infinitely_many: If the two equations have the same graph, then the system has infinitely many solutions.
